III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Special evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327
Section (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to possible
Description noncompliance with any foster home rule, the agency must do all
the following:
1

(b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as soon as is
indicated, based on the information received, but not later than 7
calendar days after receipt of the information.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Parents publicly posting pictures of foster child and agency
is aware and has not done anything.
Investigation It was alleged the foster parents or Youth A had posted pictures of
Youth A online.
Interviews:
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 11/8/2024. Chief
Administrator stated he was unaware of the allegations, but
provided staff contact information to assist in this investigation.
I interviewed Program Manager by phone on 11/08/2024.
Program Manager stated Youth A is in a licensed foster
home/borrowed bed and Program Manager provided additional
staff contact information to assist in the completion of this
investigation.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor by phone on 1/14/2025.
Foster Care Supervisor stated Complainant sent pictures of Youth
A to the agency and alleged the pictures were posted online by
the foster parents of Youth A. Foster Care Supervisor stated they
discussed the situation with the foster parents of Youth A. The
foster parents reported Youth A was at the fair and another family
was there with children who were friends with Youth A, so Youth A
was allowed to spend some time with them and go on some rides
with them. Foster Care Supervisor stated it was the parents of the
children who were friends of Youth A who took pictures of their
children, not Youth A. The parents of the other children posted
pictures of their children, not Youth A. Youth A can be partially
seen in the background of a couple of the pictures that were
posted. Foster Care Supervisor confirmed it was not the foster
parents of Youth A posting the pictures as noted by the online
documentation. Foster Care Supervisor submitted the pictures
that were received.
Three attempted contacts were made to Complainant with no
additional information provided.
Documents Reviewed:
2

I received and reviewed the pictures that were sent to the agency
and confirmed they were not posted by the foster parents of Youth
A.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as determined by the
interviews that were completed and the documentation that was
provided/reviewed. The pictures were not posted by the foster
parents of Youth A and Youth A is only visible in the background
of a public area.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
